reviews.review: This movie is GREAT!! The writers down to the actors and music are/did amazing! This is my 3rd time watching it and it is still worth the watch.

A masterful, original and captivating film that from scene one clicked for me. While this is mostly a horror film, it also blends in a lot of other genres like comedy and musical in a great way. The setpieces are very entertaining and well crafted, but this film also has a lot of thematic weight and undertones that i thought was explored in a clever, powerful and subdued kind of way. Michael B. Jordan kills it in his dual performance, and i also though the rest of the cast did a solid job. The editing is elegant, the score is inducing eargasm and the visual palette is beautiful. I just love Ryan Coogler's filmmaking style. You can tell how much this film meant to him and the passion is felt through every frame. In the overcrowded field of franchise movies, remakes, reboots and whatnot, this is the type of film we need more of. The only minor nitpick i have with this movie is the final shot, which didn't do too much for me. I am not saying that it is bad by any means, but it didn't hit me as much i had hoped. Overall, a fantastic and highly enjoyable movie with a fair amount of well-presented subtext that i strongly recommend checking out. This movie is a reminder to the wonderment that film can produce.

One of the best movies I‚Äôve ever seen! Sinners is a complete cinematic experience‚Äîblending happiness, terror, laughter, and romance into a beautifully crafted, thought-provoking plot. The storytelling was so compelling and the theater experience so immersive, I went back to see it a second time. Highly recommend. 10/10.

Another regurgitated Vampire flick - this time it's a mix of Crossroads and From Dusk til Dawn with a gratuitous machinegunning of the KKK at dawn after all the Vampires evaporated into pillars of sparks. Great acting, sets, cars, costuming. Coulda been a great story about a coupla black brothers returning South to open up a blues club bankrolled by money stolen from Capone. Talented actors, good chemistry, and a great set and a movie with a vibe ruined by inserting vampire nonsense into it. Take the same actors and set, even the director, and do it over. Develop the relationships within the cast, play way more blues music, integrate the racial tensions of the time (without over doing it), you had the feel and the character of the integrated south and its tensions nailed.=, then went stupid. This was a story meant to be based on the reality of the time and the Blues Culture - not goddamned vampires.

I'm writing this review in regards to the 70mm feature. This is my third time viewing the film. I saw it in IMAX 2D first. Then I saw it in a regular 2D setting. I drove from Houston to Dallas to view it in IMAX 2D 70mm. I must say, the 3-1/2hr trip was worth it. I felt so immersed in the movie even after this being my 3rd viewing. It felt new and rejuvenated with the new visuals I was getting. I honestly wish this format was around for a lot of other films. It sucks that I could only experience it with this film once. Nonetheless I will cherish the crisp colors and depth of detail on the characters when it entered the 1:43:1 aspect ratio. It's an immersion I've never experienced with cinema in 35yrs.

Powerful. Soulful. Unrelenting. Sinners isn‚Äôt just a film it‚Äôs a visceral experience. This masterpiece bleeds raw humanity from every frame, exposing the dark underbelly of redemption, guilt, and grace with unapologetic grit. The performances are nothing short of soul-baring each character carved from flesh, bone, and buried regret. You don‚Äôt watch Sinners, you feel it, deep in your being. The cinematography is hauntingly beautiful, capturing pain and silence with reverence. The writing is sharp and unflinching, laced with spiritual tension and moral ambiguity that leaves you reflecting long after the credits roll. Run to see this movie, especially in 70mm IMAX.

In Sinners, director Ryan Coogler and star Michael B. Jordan reunite to deliver what may be their most spiritually charged and politically urgent work to date. More than a film, Sinners is a mirror‚Äîboldly reflecting the buried traumas and enduring strength of Black America. Jordan‚Äôs performance is raw and riveting, carrying a generational weight that never feels forced. Coogler‚Äôs direction transforms symbolic imagery‚Äîbaptismal water, fractured stained glass, the pulpit and the prison‚Äîinto poetic language. Each frame breathes with historical memory and present-day urgency. Rather than spoon-feed its audience, Sinners trusts us to sit in discomfort and revelation. For Black viewers, especially, it speaks directly and powerfully: a cinematic sermon that interrogates systems of sin and survival. Coogler doesn‚Äôt just tell a story‚Äîhe resurrects one. Without question, Sinners stands as one of the most meaningful cinematic achievements of the decade.

Sinners is a stylish, high-octane ride that injects fresh blood into the vampire genre. With slick action sequences, a genuinely original story, and a cast of compelling, well-drawn characters, this film stands out as a bold and entertaining addition to the supernatural action lineup. The fight choreography is a highlight‚Äîbrutal, fast-paced, and beautifully shot. But what really elevates Sinners is its commitment to character. Each member of the ensemble feels distinct and layered, with motivations that make the drama hit just as hard as the violence. The world-building is sharp and creative, offering a new spin on vampire lore without feeling forced or gimmicky. There are a few pacing hiccups here and there, but overall the direction keeps things moving with confidence and energy. It‚Äôs stylish without being hollow, and fun without losing emotional stakes. A solid 4-star experience that proves there's still plenty of life left in the vampire genre when it's done right. Definitely worth a watch.

incredible. Great exposition, great history, loved the metaphors used about black culture in American History. the horror aspect was very cool and the action was satisfying and fun to watch. the character work and writing was phenomenal. Better than anything Disney is making these days.

I really liked the theater and the ambience. The people were all very polite and had minimal-to-no-talking. My only complaints was that the sound was a little quiet and that the film was a little dim, but those could just be me unaccustomed to 70mm film (it was my first time seeing it). Thanks for having such a cool theater and screen available to the public!

Watching The Sinners in a 70mm theater was nothing short of extraordinary. The format brought every frame to life with breathtaking clarity and depth‚Äîan experience that completely pulled me into the world of the film. The story was gripping from start to finish, layered with emotional depth, suspense, and unexpected turns. Each moment felt intentional and powerful. The acting was phenomenal‚Äîevery performance felt raw, real, and deeply human. The cast delivered with intensity and subtlety, making it easy to connect with the characters on every level. It wasn‚Äôt just a movie‚Äîit was an experience. Seeing it in 70mm elevated every scene, every emotion, and every nuance of this beautifully told story. I walked out feeling moved, stunned, and grateful for the ride. Absolutely unforgettable.

My Review - Sinners (Excellent) Before I forget ***STAY FOR THE CREDITS*** You will think there will be no more. Trust me. There is. You will get 15 more minutes worth of movie which could be an opening for a Sinners 2. A lot of people walked out and missed it. Now on to the review. I haven‚Äôt seen movie reviews this good in a long time. You would think this movie will be a catalyst for world peace the way reviewers were talking. I went in skeptical because 99.9% of the time they are wrong. Well, this is the .1% they are correct. Visually stunning, well acted (Michael B. Jordan plays dual roles as the Smokestack twins and actually does it well), an original storyline and a killer soundtrack if you like blues music. The first act of the film is in no hurry to get to the second act. It‚Äôs when characters are introduced before heading towards the part of the movie you are waiting for. It‚Äôs necessary for the viewer to actually develop feelings for the characters. The movie merges the past, present, and future through music. In today‚Äôs political climate some may have problems with the honest portrayal of black history and its reality. It‚Äôs a shame I have to bring it up. Reviewers say this is the best movie of the year. I have to agree and I will raise it. This movie is an epic masterpiece and will be a classic. Oh yeah‚Ä¶. and there are vampires. Get your tickets now. This movie deserves to have Barbie numbers in ticket sales and I will be watching!
One of the best movies I‚Äôve seen in a long time
Casting was phenomenal! Music was inspiring! Concept was gripping! Lots of layers to unfold.

A must-watch for those who love or hate horror. This movie has soul, meaning, and a hypnotic, dreamlike quality.

This was a strange watch. The storyline and character development felt patchy- really thorough in some cases and massive gaps in others. For example if you‚Äôre going to make the opening seem like the whole movie is centred around Preachers special ability why barely address this in the film? The musical scene that tried to depict this was a good start but not enough to walk away with a clear understanding. I still don‚Äôt really get what his special ability was other than the literal dialogue. Could have been a larger part of the plot line. I feel like the slow build up of suspense was lacking for a film classified as thriller/horror. The first 2/3 of the movie felt like a meaningful timepiece drama and the final 3rd felt like it was an entirely different film. The vampires themselves felt more like satire than actual feared characters. Especially the twin. He was too likeable and familiar as someone meant to be feared. More work needed to be done to break down all of the rapport we built with him through out the film before trying to make us see him as a villain. The automation of the weapons/ modernisation of the gun violence felt out of place for the period. The use of electric guitar scores in crucial moments also fits with the above. Didn‚Äôt feel like it fit in for the time period. Plus the closing KKK scene felt like a desperate attempt to draw deeper meaning at the end. Instead just came off as a stereotypical shoot out scene trying to wear the dress of a deeper message. Overall poorly done. Foundations were there but fell massively short and all of the raving reviews make me wonder if we watched the same film.

I went into the movie, blind, not knowing what to expect. I don‚Äôt know if I would have gone if I heard people describe it as being about vampires. It is SOOO much more than that!! The writing and acting is excellent. The symbolisms still have me pondering aspects of the movie. Well done!!

The first 30 minutes and last 20 minutes or more were the worst. Just wasn‚Äôt a good movie. There were some African Americans that became excited when he mowed down like 20 KKK members at the end. It was a strange movie and strange experience. Not sure what the themes were. The story line obviously sucked and my wife said it was all over the place. I liked the music and the vampires though. Two stars for those aspects.
An original film with depth, humor, lessons, and soul. Everyone who had a hand in bringing this to life deserves all the accolades, attention, and applause they are sure to receive.

Os irm√£os g√™meos Smoke e Stack retornam √† sua cidade natal, depois de um tempo em Chicago. Eles resolvem abrir um clube de blues para a comunidade negra local, por√©m um mal mais antigo est√° √† espreita. Ryan Coogler est√° se tornando uma das vozes negras mais potentes no cinema americano. Depois de continuar a franquia Rocky, criando uma nova com o filho do Apolo Creed e fazer um dos melhores filmes de super-her√≥is, apresentando o Pantera Negra, dando um grande destaque a ele, Coogler nos traz um filme de vampiros, mas com uma leitura social extremamente importante. Aqui ele retorna aos anos 30. O mundo tinha sa√≠do de uma guerra, mas logo entraria em outra. Sementes come√ßavam a ser plantadas referentes aos direitos negros em uma regi√£o extremamente preconceituosa e atrasada. O clube dos irm√£os Smoke e Stack √© um lugar de celebra√ß√£o da cultura negra, como na cena mais famosa do filme, onde o personagem de Miles Caton se apresenta e se torna um gri√¥, abrindo portas para o passado e futuro, onde a m√∫sica e a dan√ßa se misturam em √©pocas e estilos diferentes. Mas tamb√©m a cultura asi√°tica √© homenageada. J√° √© uma das cenas mais belas e fortes desse ano. Mas al√©m de ser um local de celebra√ß√£o, √© um local de resist√™ncia. Os vampiros representam n√£o somente a amea√ßa √†quele grupo de pessoas, mas tamb√©m uma amea√ßa √† liberdade que eles constru√≠ram naquele lugar, naquela noite. √â muito interessante fazer uma rela√ß√£o entre a tradi√ß√£o que um vampiro tem que receber a permiss√£o do dono da casa para poder entrar e os negros n√£o terem o direito de entrar em todos os lugares. Ou de haver lugares separados para eles. E ao serem mordidos e transformados em vampiros, os negros perdiam sua identidade, tornando-se um s√≥ com o personagem de Jack O'Connell, como na cena onde uma roda se forma em torno dele e todos cantam aquela can√ß√£o irlandesa, como se falasse a todos eles igual. Outro ponto extremamente positivo √© a trilha sonora e as can√ß√µes se encaixam perfeitamente bem, quase tornando o filme um musical, onde blues, country e can√ß√µes tradicionais se misturam, unindo-se nos seus pontos comuns. Al√©m do estilo de Coogler ser bastante percept√≠vel, √© claro que conseguimos ver influ√™ncias de Spike Lee, Quentin Tarantino e Jordan Peele. O interessante √© que o filme ocorre em um √∫nico dia, da compra da serraria pelos g√™meos, at√© o nascer do outro dia. Apenas um dia pode ser fugaz, mas aqui foi eterno. Parab√©ns, Ryan Coogler.

The story was great. Everything was amazing. The music, the action.

I have not in many a year seen a movie as layered as artistic or as entertaining as this one. Ryan Coogler somehow seamlessly interwove history, racial politics, southern folklore, and reconstruction religion, into a vampire movie that was not only beautifully shot but had you on the edge of your seat. The final act was also a wonderful and unexpected turn. I wish I could go back with virgin eyes to see this again for the first time. An awesome, awesome film.
incredible. one of the best movies I've seen this year.
The portrayal of music and cultures. Also Hallie steinfield.
Absolutely EXCELLENT! If any movie deserves an Oscar this year it‚Äôs this one. Especially for the music, incredible incredible music

Best. Bravo. A classic. I will see it 5 more times. Two is not enough
Not too scary after all, and SOOO well written! Would love to see it again on imax!
awesome movie. Kept me on the edge of my seat. Lots of action and suspense.
The story was captivating and gripping throughout the entire movie.
Movie of the year. The backstory, the character development, casting all perfection.
Great movie with good plot.

I have never written a review on any movie and I have watched A LOT of movies. This is a special one. The music, the story, the characters! It delivers in so many unexpected ways - 10/10! You HAVE to see it!!!!!!

Wow, this movie has pretty much everything I was expecting and more. The writing, acting, cinematography, even the lighting stood out. But the music is the mvp here. I wad expecting more tension and I very much believe that there are moments that would have hit harder if the trailers hadn't shown them, which is a little annoying. I also don't think movie has a lot of rewatches in it for me which also marks it down a bit but definitely keen to watch it once or twice more
If you like horror films, this movie is an absolute Must see! from start to finish! very entertaining!
Fascinating film with many layers. Superb production (esp the long dancing sequence that spans the ages). Only 4 stars since it went a little too long. Some things could have been cut.
Taken off guard, was not expecting the outcome. Enjoy the movie.
The story line, the production, the music, that acting, every thing is spot on amazing. This is a must see for any one who loves thrilling and spine chilling movies.
Amazing in every single possible way- see it on the screen like it was meant to be seen- then obsess over the soundtrack from home
An absolutely amazing movie!!! It hit so many different aspects of emotion! The music was amazing and the acting on point as well!
Good, unique movie! Wish it was alittle scarier! But great movie.

Savoury and sensational. A southern gothic like no other.

SINNERS blew my head off... a slow rhythmic burn that drums to its own beat that moves you into a blood-thirsty frenzy with notes that rip a hole through your soul as it takes you back to the ancestors, the ancients and catapults you into a devastating reality. Forgive us. We sin. Ryan Coogler is a genius... Let there be more.
Love love love this movie
I am not someone who enjoys watching movies more than once, but I saw this last week and am considering paying to see it again. LOVE the soundtrack and overall production

Im sure I missed all of the subtle and not so subtle symbolism. The dance scenes were fantastic. The music was amazing. The acting was great. Michis ael B Jordan is fantastic as always. The supporting cast also fantastic. Didnt really understand a lot of the stuff thrown in. Im sure Im not the only person. Its definitely thought-provoking though.
Love the history, vampires and everything else. Great movie.

Overall acting was terrific, but I have no idea what this movie was about. A mumbo jumbo series of scenes totally disjointed with no consistent meaning of continuity. A 1932 dance hall scene of black dancers are all of a sudden intertwined with a weird set of dancers with modern day masks and costumes...huh? It's 1932 and all of a sudden someone is using modern day weaponry. Maybe I'm not cool but I didn't understand a word they were saying. I'm not sure who was the intended audience for this movie.
Mixing all different genres into one pile of dogshit.
A masterpiece of a movie. It was terrifying, sexy, gory and funny. This movie is easily the greatest movie ever made and deserves to be seen!

Great depth! I need to see this again, as I am sure I missed some things.

I rate this movie in the same category as The Shining, Poltergeist, and the Birds. It starts out slow, and builds to an explosive finish. Stay until you see the final logo for both trailers (they tie up some loose ends, and maybe set the stage for a sequel)

Incredible. Will be going back to see again. So thoughtful and unique. Respects the genre and the audience and is clearly driven by passion and vision from the filmmaker. A completely immersive, layered experience.

Amazing, absolutely. The music is amazing, and the plot/story fantastic, it has now became one of my favorite movies.

Great vampire film with beautiful visuals and stunning cinematography, layered and violent in each of its delightful twists.
what a mess. but a watchable movie just the same. like a talented kid in film school got a 100 million dollars to make a movie.

Movie is the best musical, comedy drama vampire horror me and my wife have ever seen. The soundtrack is amazing, the movie has great feel and was entertaining the entire way through. See it on a big screen with the best sound you can find. For us it Bucket list and we will probably go see it again. 5 out 5 vampires and all the tomatoes you can eat like a Vampire would. Side note: It is 137 minutes long so I did subtract half a star. Stay past the first set of credits. There is a hidden scene.
This movie was a drama masterpiece told in a very classical way.

A pretty perfect movie. Very mature themes, so definitely a hard R (IMO). However, extremely well written, beautifully directed, and an exceptionally talented cast. I plan to see it a couple more times in theaters.
